attributes.name: FileDropzone
attributes.description:
FileDropzone is a component that will allow users to upload files by drag and drop.

{{#file-dropzone name="photos" as |dropzone queue|}}
  {{#if dropzone.active}}
    {{#if dropzone.valid}}
      Drop to upload
    {{else}}
      Invalid
    {{/if}}
  {{else if queue.files.length}}
    Uploading {{queue.files.length}} files. ({{queue.progress}}%)
  {{else}}
    <h4>Upload Images</h4>
    <p>
      {{#if dropzone.supported}}
        Drag and drop images onto this area to upload them or
      {{/if}}
      {{#file-upload name="photos"
                    accept="image/*"
                    multiple=true
                    onfileadd=(action "uploadImage")}}
        <a id="upload-image" tabindex=0>Add an Image.</a>
      {{/file-upload}}
    </p>
  {{/if}}
{{/file-dropzone}}
import Controller from '@ember/controller';

export default Ember.Route.extend({
  actions: {
    uploadImage(file) {
     file.upload(URL, options).then((response) => {
        ...
     });
    }
  }
});

arguments.name: multiple
arguments.description: Whether multiple files can be selected when uploading.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the queue to upload the file to.

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description: If set, disables input and prevents files from being added to the queue

arguments.name: accept
arguments.description: A list of MIME types / extensions to be accepted by the input

arguments.name: onfileadd
arguments.description:
onfileadd is called when a file is selected.

When multiple files are selected, this function is called once for every file that was selected.

arguments.name: ondragenter
arguments.description: ondragenter is called when a file has entered the dropzone.

arguments.name: ondragleave
arguments.description: ondragleave is called when a file has left the dropzone.

arguments.name: ondrop
arguments.description: ondrop is called when a file has been dropped.

arguments.name: allowUploadsFromWebsites
arguments.description: Whether users can upload content from websites by dragging images from another webpage and dropping it into your app. The default is false to prevent cross-site scripting issues.

arguments.name: cursor
arguments.description:
This is the type of cursor that should be shown when a drag event happens.

Corresponds to dropEffect.

This is one of the following:

  • copy
  • move
  • link

attributes.name: FileUpload
attributes.description:
FileUpload is a component that will open a dialog for users to browse their device for files that they want to upload.

For the component to work at its best, each FileUpload should be named so the upload can be persisted across pages and show the correct upload percentage when a user visits the page.

For a basic use-case of uploading a file after a form is submitted, you can stash the file for later and upload it on the submission of the form.

For this example, we'll look at a relatively standard profile form using ember-changeset to keep track of changes made to the form:

{{#with (changeset model) as |changeset|}}
  <form submit={{action 'submit' changeset}}>
    <label for='name'>
    {{input type='string' value=changeset.name id='name'}}

    {{#file-upload name="avatar"
                   accept="image/*"
                   onfileadd=(action 'setAvatar' changeset)}}
      {{#if changeset.avatar}}
        <img src={{changeset.avatar.url}} />
        <a id="upload-avatar" tabindex=0>Add a photo of yourself</a>
      {{else}}
        <a id="upload-avatar" tabindex=0>Add a photo of yourself</a>
      {{/if}}
    {{/file-upload}}
  </form>
{{/with}}
import Controller from '@ember/controller';

export default Controller.extend({
  actions: {
    submit(changeset) {
      if (changeset.avatar) {
        let file = changeset.avatar;
        file.upload('/upload').then((response) => {
          changeset.set('avatar', {
            name: file.get('name'),
            url: response.headers.Location
          });
        });
      }

      this.currentModel.setProperties(changeset.get('change'));
      return this.currentModel.save();
    },

    setAvatar(changeset, file) {
      changeset.set('avatar', file);

      // Set the URL so we can see a preview
      file.readAsDataURL().then((url) => {
        changeset.set('url', url);
      });
    }
  }
});

arguments.name: multiple
arguments.description: Whether multiple files can be selected when uploading.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the queue to upload the file to.

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description: If set, disables input and prevents files from being added to the queue

arguments.name: accept
arguments.description: A list of MIME types / extensions to be accepted by the input

onfileadd is called when a file is selected.

When multiple files are selected, this function is called once for every file that was selected.

arguments.name: capture

attributes.name: File
attributes.description: Files provide a uniform interface for interacting with data that can be uploaded or read.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique id generated for this file.

params.name: url
params.description: Your server endpoint where to upload the file

params.name: url
params.description: Your server endpoint where to upload the file

params.name: opts
params.description: { fileKey: string, data: { key: string } }

methods.name: readAsBinaryString
methods.description: Resolves with Blob as binary string

methods.name: readAsText
methods.description: Resolves with Blob as plain text

methods.name: fromBlob
methods.description: Creates a file object that can be read or uploaded to a server from a Blob object.

params.name: blob
params.description: The blob to create the file from.

params.name: source
params.description: The source that created the blob.

methods.name: fromDataURL
methods.description: Creates a file object that can be read or uploaded to a server from a data URL.

params.name: dataURL
params.description: The data URL to create the file from.

params.name: source
params.description: The source of the data URL.

accessors.name: size
accessors.description: The size of the file in bytes.

accessors.name: type
accessors.description:
The MIME type of the file.

For a image file this may be image/png.

accessors.name: extension
accessors.description: Returns the appropriate file extension of the file according to the type

accessors.name: state
accessors.description:
The current state that the file is in. One of:

  • queued
  • uploading
  • timed_out
  • aborted
  • uploaded
  • failed

Implementers should call flush() on the file's queue after mutating this property.

accessors.name: source
accessors.description:
The source of the file. This is useful for applications that want to gather analytics about how users upload their content.

This property can be one of the following:

  • browse
  • drag-and-drop
  • web
  • data-url
  • blob

browse is the source when the file is created using the native file picker.

drag-and-drop is the source when the file was created using drag and drop from their desktop.

web is the source when the file was created by dragging the file from another webpage.

data-url is the source when the file is created from a data URL using the fromDataURL method for files. This usually means that the file was created manually by the developer on behalf of the user.

blob is the source when the file is created from a blob using the fromBlob method for files. This usually means that the file was created manually by the developer.

attributes.name: FileQueue
attributes.description:
file-queue helper is one of the core primitives of ember-file-upload. It has three different flavors of invocation. The first is a bare call, which will return the master queue:

{{#with (file-queue) as |queue|}}
  {{queue.progress}}%
{{/with}}

If called with a name property, it will return the queue of that name:

{{#with (file-queue name="photos") as |queue|}}
  {{queue.progress}}%
{{/with}}

attributes.name: Queue
attributes.description:
The Queue is a collection of files that are being manipulated by the user.

Queues are designed to persist the state of uploads when a user navigates around your application.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The unique identifier of the queue.

Queue names should be deterministic so they can be retrieved. It's recommended to provide a helpful name.

If the queue belongs to a top level collection, photos, the good name for this queue may be "photos".

If you're uploading images to an artwork, the best name would incoporate both "artworks" and the identifier of the artwork. A good name for this queue may be "artworks/{{id}}/photos", where {{id}} is a dynamic segment that is generated from the artwork id.

fields.name: files
fields.description:
The list of files in the queue. This automatically gets flushed when all the files in the queue have settled.

Note that files that have failed need to be manually removed from the queue. This is so they can be retried without resetting the state of the queue, orphaning the file from its queue. Upload failures can happen due to a timeout or a server response. If you choose to use the abort method, the file will fail to upload, but will be removed from the requeuing proccess, and will be considered to be in a settled state.

params.name: file
params.description: The file to append to the queue

params.name: fileList
params.description: The event triggered from the DOM that contains a list of files

params.name: file
params.description: The file to remove from the queue.

attributes.name: FileQueue
attributes.description:
The file queue service is a global file queue that manages all files being uploaded.

This service can be used to query the current upload state when a user leaves the app, asking them whether they want to cancel the remaining uploads.

fields.name: files
fields.description:
The list of all files in queues. This automatically gets flushed when all the files in the queue have settled.

Note that files that have failed need to be manually removed from the queue. This is so they can be retried without resetting the state of the queue, orphaning the file from its queue. Upload failures can happen due to a timeout or a server response. If you choose to use the abort method, the file will fail to upload, but will be removed from the requeuing proccess, and will be considered to be in a settled state.

methods.name: flush
methods.description:
Flushes the files property if they have settled. This will only flush files when all files have arrived at a terminus of their state chart.

    .------.     .---------.     .--------.
o--| queued |-->| uploading |-->| uploaded |
    `------`     `---------`     `--------`
       ^              |    .-------.
       |              |`->| aborted |
       |              |    `-------`
       |  .------.    |    .---------.
       `-| failed |<-` `->| timed_out |-.
       |  `------`         `---------`  |
       `-------------------------------`

Files may be requeued by the user in the failed or timed_out states.

methods.name: find
methods.description: Returns a queue with the given name

returns.description: The queue or null if it doesn't exist yet.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the queue to find

methods.name: create
methods.description: Create a new queue with the given name.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the queue to create

accessors.name: size
accessors.description: The total size of all files currently being uploaded in bytes.

accessors.name: loaded
accessors.description: The number of bytes that have been uploaded to the server.

accessors.name: progress
accessors.description: The current progress of all uploads, as a percentage in the range of 0 to 100.

attributes.name: FileReader
attributes.description:
Provides a promise-aware interface for reading files.

import File from 'ember-file-upload/file';
import FileReader from 'ember-file-upload/system/file-reader';

let reader = new FileReader();
let file = File.fromDataURL('data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAAFCAYAAACNbyblAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAACNJREFUCB1jYICC6dOn/4exwTRMAEYzwBnoOmASMBpuDLIAAIVVFiE0cg0oAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC');

reader.readAsDataURL(file.blob).then((url) => {
  return url;
}, function (err) {
  console.error(err);
});

Promises can be aborted, which will cancel the file upload:

let promise = reader.readAsDataURL(file.blob);
promise.then((url) => {
  return url;
}, (err) => {
  console.error(err);
});

promise.abort().then(() => {
  console.error('cancelled reading file');
});

methods.name: readAsArrayBuffer
methods.description: Reads the file and returns a promise that will return the blob as ArrayBuffer.

returns.description: A promise that will return the file as an ArrayBuffer

methods.name: readAsDataURL
methods.description:
Reads the file and returns a promise that will return the blob as data URL.

This is useful for reading images to display as a preview in the browser.

returns.description: A promise that will return the file as a data URL

methods.name: readAsBinaryString
methods.description:
Reads the file and returns a promise that will return the blob as binary string.

This is useful for reading images or files that are not plain text.

returns.description: A promise that will return the file as a binary string

methods.name: readAsText
methods.description:
Reads the file and returns a promise that will return the blob as text.

This is useful for reading plain text files.

returns.description: A promise that will return the file as text

functions.name: selectFiles
functions.description:
Triggers a change event on a FileUpload input with files.

All files must be HTML5 File objects.

A single file, or multiple files may be passed as arguments.

  // A single file
  const file = new File([], 'dingus.txt');
  await selectFiles('.file-upload input', file);
  // Multiple files
  const file1 = new File([], 'dingus1.txt');
  const file2 = new File([], 'dingus2.txt');
  await selectFiles('.file-upload input', file1, file2);

Returns Promise<void> which resolves when the application is settled.

params.name: selector
params.description: DOM selector for a FileUpload input

params.name: files
params.description: One or more File objects

functions.name: dragAndDrop
functions.description:
Triggers dragenter, dragover, and drop events on a FileDropzone with files.

All files must be HTML5 File objects.

A single file, or multiple files may be passed as arguments.

  // A single file
  const file = new File([], 'dingus.txt');
  await dragAndDrop('.file-dropzone', file);
  // Multiple files
  const file1 = new File([], 'dingus1.txt');
  const file2 = new File([], 'dingus2.txt');
  await dragAndDrop('.file-dropzone', file1, file2);

Returns Promise<void> which resolves when the application is settled.

params.name: selector
params.description: DOM selector for a FileDropzone

params.name: files
params.description: One or more File objects

functions.name: dragEnter
functions.description:
Triggers a dragenter event on a FileDropzone with files.

All files must be HTML5 File objects.

A single file, or multiple files may be passed as arguments.

  // A single file
  const file = new File([], 'dingus.txt');
  await dragEnter('.file-dropzone', file);
  // Multiple files
  const file1 = new File([], 'dingus1.txt');
  const file2 = new File([], 'dingus2.txt');
  await dragEnter('.file-dropzone', file1, file2);

Returns Promise<void> which resolves when the application is settled.

params.name: selector
params.description: DOM selector for a FileDropzone

params.name: files
params.description: One or more File objects

functions.name: dragLeave
functions.description:
Triggers a dragleave event on a FileDropzone with files.

All files must be HTML5 File objects.

A single file, or multiple files may be passed as arguments.

  // A single file
  const file = new File([], 'dingus.txt');
  await dragLeave('.file-dropzone', file);
  // Multiple files
  const file1 = new File([], 'dingus1.txt');
  const file2 = new File([], 'dingus2.txt');
  await dragLeave('.file-dropzone', file1, file2);

Returns Promise<void> which resolves when the application is settled.

params.name: selector
params.description: DOM selector for a FileDropzone

params.name: files
params.description: One or more File objects
